name: manuka
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] (also manuka bush, manuka tree) a small tree from New Zealand and Australia, with sweet-smelling leaves that can be used to make tea and white, pink, or red flowers that bees use to produce a special kind of honey: In New Zealand, sawdust from the native manuka (tea tree) is used for smoking fish. We saw a kiwi bird in the manuka bushes beside the path. The lodge sits above a manuka grove with views over the Pacific.
[ U ] (also manuka honey) a type of honey that is believed to be good for your health, made by bees that feed on the flowers of the manuka plant: Many of the claims for manuka's health-giving properties are not supported by evidence. He began researching manuka honey, and has led the way in the study of honey as a medicine.
More examplesFewer examples New Zealand's scrubby mānuka trees with their creamy blossoms used to be chopped down by farmers who considered them worthless. You can walk through beech and manuka forest to Mistletoe Bay.This is one of the city's hippest restaurants, where you can breakfast on toasted sourdough with Manuka honey.He claims there is reasonable lab evidence for manuka honey's antibacterial effect.He uses a particular variety of honey known as manuka.Mānuka honey is produced from the nectar of the mānuka tree.
